main event: A bright flash was observed for 10 seconds by a Coast Guard heading at 26:02N 143:19E in the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object changed from a steady light to a blinking light before disappearing.
The brightness and blinking action of the object was unusual and warranted further investigation.
The object was evaluated as not being a threat.
The report was sent to various military and intelligence agencies.
The report was marked as an 'Advance copy' that was delivered to 'CIN and OOP-OP'.
sighted object: bright flash that changed from a steady light to a blinking light
